lines.text: Pay no attention to that man behind the curtain.
I want somethin' I ain't ever had.
How you gonna get that?
Guts and luck.
Luck! Hell, luck is bein' a Vanderbilt or a Carnegie.
Just grabbin' somethin' good when it comes by.
Sure, enough, honey.
Which way are you headed?
I don't know.
Bill, I wanna thank you. You're a real straight shooter.
Hey, whoa, honey, I'm not that straight shooter.
Huh?
I mean, you ain't even seen me shoot.
Huh?
I'll at least light a fire for you. You probably don't even have any matches. Do you?

Everybody's strikin'. East coast. West coast. What happens if everybody strikes? Firemen. Police. You know what that means? Anarchy. Chaos. We got a socialist people goin' on now. We got Reds comin' in. Reds around us. Reds in Washington goin' down. What's going to happen?
What are these Reds? That's all I ever hear about is Reds.
Big Bill Shelly, he's a Red.
You're pretty. Very pretty. You have a remarkable figure. Quite - full.
Thank you.
Hey, who is that? Hey, what is this?

[Cradled in Bill's arms]
This is Bill. I've known him awhile.
Well, you've known me awhile, too, Toots.
It's not the same. Not at all.
Harvey, who is that fella son of a bitch?
How's that Sheriff? I mean, which son of a bitch?
You know the one I mean. The one over there shaking hands with that nigger.
That's Big Bill Shelly, notorious Bolshevik. We drug him in last evening.
Well, I don't know about no Bolshevik, But I know, sure enough, he's a nigger lover. Harvey, go over there and make a nigger outta that white one.

She's got her skirt up, somewheres around her chin. I got a clear view up to the ol' kazoo. I finally get her home and she says, I swear to God, she says, "Deputy, I don't know how to thank you." And I says, "Why, honey, I believe you do!" So, I climb in the back seat, their seat, and she lies back, she puts her legs up, and she acts just like she was born to do it.
Can I be of service, ma'am?
Oh, shit, yes! I just can't figure out how to put that thing on that thing.
Well, honey, just leave it to Harvey.
Where you goin' little lady?
Ah, to Africa.
Africa?
I'm a missionary. I've dedicated my life to the black heathen.

[Snickers, reading a newspaper article]
Listen to this, "The notorious labor radical and Bolshivek spy, Big Bill Shelly, along with certain of his desperate confederates, broke out of Shelby County Penal Farm, assaulting a guard."
What's so funny about that?
I was laughing at the spy part. You don't look like no spy to me. I always thought they wear glasses.

[Reading a newspaper article]
"All other escapees, have been returned to custody, except for a negro." That's probably you, Von.
Listen, did anyone know you were comin' up this way?
Hell no.
[Sarcastically]
Just-just my police escort. Didn't you hear the sirens?
Now, don't come on smart with me, boy. They got a price on your head. You and them nuts you busted out with! Whores and niggers, my God, ain't that a nice image for unionism?
I'd do anything you want. Wanna quit, we'll quit. We'll go away.
I ain't a quitter. If you wanna leave, there are no chains on you, honey.
You dumb.
What do you mean?
I ain't leavin'.
Yes, the Reader Railroad's seen a great deal these days. Woes, strikes, and, now, the indignity of it all, gangs of Communists, hoes - pardon me, ma'am - and niggers.
If I give you, eh, fifteen dollars, can I stay? I don't wanna sleep alone tonight.
It looks like it's really over for you now, huh?
Hell no. Until I'm dead.
You don't have to rush it.
It's appointed, each man to die. Judgement
You don't have to rush it.

[Final words]
No! Don't take him! You can't take him. Can't take him. Stop it! Don't take him. Don't - take him! No! - No! - No!
Hey, Bertha!
